newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Westfield plans to raise up to US$315 mln.
newsitem.headline: Westfield plans to raise up to US$315 mln.

text.p: Westfield America Trust said on Monday it planned to raise up to about A$315 million in its proposed listing on the New York Stock Exchange.
Westfield said an updated draft prospectus for the capital raising by Westfield America Inc has been lodged with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
The prospectus provides for a capital issue of 18 million shares at a price range of US$16.00 to US$17.50, raising US288 million to US$315 million.
Westfield America said previously it would look to raise about US$400 million.
Westfield America said also it had entered into conditional agreements to buy interests in two U.S. shopping malls for US$185.5 million.

Westfield America plans to buy the remaining 70 percent interest in its Annapolis Mall and adjoining land for US$133 million, and a 70 percent partnership interest in Wheaton Plaza in Maryland for US$52.5 million.
Westfield Holdings Ltd, Australia's largest shopping centre owner, announced in March plans for its U.S. arm to list in New York.
Under the plan, Westfield America Trust would list its U.S. vehicle CenterMark Properties Inc as Westfield America Inc, diluting its 67.2 percent stake in CenterMark to about 50 percent.
Westfield chairman Frank Lowy told shareholders at an extraordinary general meeting earlier this month that the company was contemplating certain acquisitions.
